sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cholesky decomposition
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using Cholesky decomposition:

$$\begin{bmatrix}4 & -2 & 1\\ -2 & 5 & -3\\ 1 & -3 & 8\end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix}x\\y\\z\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}9\\-6\\30\end{bmatrix}$$

Round your answer to two decimal places.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using Cholesky decomposition, we first decompose the given matrix A into the product of a lower triangular matrix L and its transpose L^T, such that A = LL^T.

Matrix A:
$$\begin{bmatrix}4 & -2 & 1\\ -2 & 5 & -3\\ 1 & -3 & 8\end{bmatrix}$$

Matrix L:
$$\begin{bmatrix}l_{11} & 0 & 0\\ l_{21} & l_{22} & 0\\ l_{31} & l_{32} & l_{33}\end{bmatrix}$$

Matrix L^T:
$$\begin{bmatrix}l_{11} & l_{21} & l_{31}\\ 0 & l_{22} & l_{32}\\ 0 & 0 & l_{33}\end{bmatrix}$$

Now, we find the elements of matrix L:

$l_{11} = \sqrt{4} = 2$

$l_{21} = -2 / 2 = -1$

$l_{22} = \sqrt{5 - (-1)^2} = 2$

$l_{31} = 1 / 2 = 0.5$

$l_{32} = (-3 - (-1)(0.5))/2 = -1.25$

$l_{33} = \sqrt{8 - 0.5^2 - (-1.25)^2} = 2.5$

So, the matrix L is:
$$\begin{bmatrix}2 & 0 & 0\\ -1 & 2 & 0\\ 0.5 & -1.25 & 2.5\end{bmatrix}$$

Now, we solve the system Ly = b, where y = L^Tx:

$$\begin{bmatrix}2 & 0 & 0\\ -1 & 2 & 0\\ 0.5 & -1.25 & 2.5\end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix}y_1\\y_2\\y_3\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}9\\-6\\30\end{bmatrix}$$

Solving for y:

$y_1 = 9 / 2 = 4.5$

$y_2 = (-6 - (-1)(4.5))/2 = -3.5$

$y_3 = (30 - 0.5(4.5) - (-1.25)(-3.5))/2.5 = 6$

Now, we solve the system L^Tx = y:

$$\begin{bmatrix}2 & -1 & 0.5\\ 0 & 2 & -1.25\\ 0 & 0 & 2.5\end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix}x\\y\\z\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}4.5\\-3.5\\6\end{bmatrix}$$

Solving for x, y, and z:

$z = 6 / 2.5 = 2.4$

$y = (-3.5 - (-1.25)(2.4))/2 = 0.7$

$x = (4.5 - (-1)(0.7) - 0.5(2.4))/2 = 1.85$

So, the solution is:
$$\begin{bmatrix}x\\y\\z\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}1.85\\0.7\\2.4\end{bmatrix}$$

Rounded to two decimal places, the solution is:
$$\begin{bmatrix}x\\y\\z\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}1.85\\0.70\\2.40\end{bmatrix}$$
